subject: Re: [junit] JUnit using Ant
messageBody:
I would change
<pathelement location="
${buildDestDir}/com/syntegra/de/net/auth/testcases"/>
with
            <pathelement path="
${buildDestDir}/com/syntegra/de/net/auth/testcases"/>
or
            <pathelement path="${buildDestDir}"/>

depending on the exact classname of AllTests.

Marc





"Thorsten Koller" <thorsten.koller@...> on 17.05.2001 13:30:56

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com

To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
cc:

Subject: [junit] JUnit using Ant




Hi!
I'm using JUnit within the following ant-target:

        <target name="runtests" depends="compiletests" if="junit.present">
                <java fork="yes" classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
taskname="junit" failonerror="false">
                        <arg value="AllTests"/>
                        <classpath>
                                <pathelement location="${buildDestDir}/../
${AppName}.jar"/>
                                <pathelement location="
${buildDestDir}/com/syntegra/de/net/auth/testcases"/>
                                <pathelement path="${ExtClassPath}" />
                                <pathelement path="${JunitPath}"/>
                        </classpath>
                </java>
        </target>

Trying to run my start class "AllTests" by typing "ant runtests", I get the
message:

"runtests:
    [junit] Class "AllTests.class" not found
    [junit] Java Result: -1"

The files are present in the directories as set in location attribute.

What does this mean.

Thanks in advance
-tk-
